The Shrine of Hope: Chapter Two
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Library: Fan Fiction, Poetry, Birthday List, Links & Non-Fiction Archive: Epics In Progress Section II: The Shrine of Hope: Chapter Two
By Brick on Wednesday, October 29, 2003 - 07:41 pm:

The next morning, I found that Picott was quite lazy for a monster! However, thus was easily solved, as yesterday's experience proved that Picott's favourite food was nuts. I tried some more things, and he liked almost all sweet things offered to him. He liked a few other things, but nuts still remained his favourite.

We went outside to try training, and he actually did pretty well! The only problem is, while dodging an avalanche, he went too far, so I had to spend the day looking for him. We went inside, and lit a fire. Picott rolled away, and came back with his new favourite pillow. I laughed, as he curled up on his pillow and went to sleep.

The next day, our neighbour, Kesha, came tearing down the mountain as her suzurin came floating down behind her. She puffed and panted as she arrived at our cabin.

"Quickly! We need to evacuate! There's a monster up there, a strong one! Not just strong, colossal! Come on, we need to leave now!"

I nodded, and turned to Picott, who was rolling back into the cabin. I called for him to stop, but he still went in.

"Go ahead, we'll catch up."

This time she nodded, and began tearing down the path again. I called out again for Picott, and he burst right out through the door of the cabin... With his pillow. I would have laughed again, but there was a sudden rumble, an earthquake-sized rumble, and we soon found ourselves tearing down the path as fast as Kesha had ran.

*********
Well, thanks for the comments, peoples! More are greatly appreciated! Now, I shall think of what to write next. Hmm... I'm thinking of introducing a new character, but I need ideas... Any of you want to be in it? Tell me a little about your character, and their monster, if you would. Thankies! ;)
